title: Quiz 4: The Normal Neonate
description: Assessment of newborn characteristics, APGAR scoring, reflexes, and immediate care.

questions.question: Review the APGAR table. A newborn has a heart rate of 110, strong cry, active motion, pink body with blue extremities, and sneezes on suction. What is the APGAR score?

richContent.content:
Sign012
AppearanceBluePink body/Blue limbsPink
PulseAbsent<100>100
GrimaceNoneGrimaceCry/Sneeze
ActivityLimpSome flexionActive
RespirationAbsentSlow/IrregularGood Cry

questions.explanation: Pulse >100 (2), Cry (2), Active (2), Pink body/Blue limbs (1), Sneeze (2). Total = 9.
questions.hint: Only one category is scoring less than 2.

questions.question: Match the newborn reflex with its description:

pairs.right: Turning head when cheek is touched
Fingers close around object in palm

questions.explanation: Moro is the startle/embrace reflex. Rooting seeks the nipple. Grasping is palmar/plantar hold. Stepping simulates walking.
questions.hint: Think about the action: Moro=Embrace, Rooting=Searching.

questions.question: Identify the mechanisms by which a newborn loses heat. (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Heat loss occurs via Evaporation, Conduction, Convection, and Radiation. Digestion generates heat.

questions.question: Physiological jaundice usually appears within the first 24 hours of life.
questions.explanation: Physiological jaundice appears from the 3rd to 6th day. Jaundice within the first 24 hours is pathological.
questions.hint: Is early jaundice normal or dangerous?

questions.question: Which ointment is applied to the newborn's eyes to prevent Ophthalmia Neonatorum?
questions.explanation: Tetracycline 1% eye ointment is used prophylactically against gonococcal/chlamydial infection.

questions.question: The normal heart rate for a newborn varies between ___BLANK___ and 160 beats per minute.
questions.explanation: Normal newborn heart rate is 120-160 bpm.
questions.hint: It is much faster than an adult's.
